properties.areaDesc: St. Louis City, MO; St. Louis, MO
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 2:31AM CST until January 18 at 5:30AM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for...
St. Louis City in east central Missouri...
St. Louis County in east central Missouri...

* Until 530 AM CST.

* At 227 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
heavy rain that has exited the area will cause urban and small
stream flooding in the advisory area. A number of creeks including
Bonhomme, Creve Coeur, Fee Fee, Two Mile, and Deer Creek were
rising rapidly due to the heavy rain that fell across the metro
area in the past 12 hours.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
St. Louis, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City,
Ballwin, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves,
Ferguson, Manchester, Creve Coeur, Overland, Clayton, Jennings, St.
Ann, Crestwood, Bridgeton and Bellefontaine Neighbors.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 261 and 277.
Interstate 70 in Missouri near exit 231.

This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic
Site, Route 66 State Park, and Castlewood State Park.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.
